授業目的: The main objectives of the course are: (1) to help students learn to think like natural-born entrepreneurs; and (2) equip themselves with the basic skills and knowledge that will enable them to establish and manage their own business.
到達目標:
"1. Determine if entrepreneurship is an appropriate career choice for you.
2. Conduct a feasibility analysis to determine the viability of a business concept and construct a business model.
3. Describe the impact of internal and external environmental factors on management decision-making.
4. Evaluate product or service viability.
5. Describe the advantages and disadvantages of the typical sources of financing.
6. Prepare and analyze a cash flow statement to identify problems and timing of cash infusion.
7. Explain typical government regulations affecting a new business.
8. Contrast the legal forms of business ownership.
9. Identify basic protections for intellectual property.
10. Demonstrate team leadership and show acceptable teamwork.
11. Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills.
12. Understand and defend ethical positions related to business ownership.
13. Practice creativity techniques to identify new ventures.
14. Incorporate diversity decisions into human resources and marketing planning.
15. Identify the advantages and disadvantages of franchising.
16. Understand the need for change and how to manage change effectively."
授業方法:
Face to face format.
Lecture, presentation, and discussion. Each lecture will be interactive. Students are encouraged to participate actively in discussions during the lecture and Q&A sessions. Students are required to make an in-class presentation on an assigned, short case study given one week's preparation time.
